item.description:
About The Hike

Soooo… this will be a point to point hike, a car spot, a “we’ll-meet-at-the-end-before-we-begin” kind of hike... a hike that starts only after we meet at the Crawford Notch Depot (located near the AMC Highland Center), so that we can park a car or two, before driving a mile or two, south, down Rt. 302, to the Webster Cliff Trail trailhead (near the Willey House Station).

Once at the trailhead, we’ll start by heading east, hiking across the Saco River, by-passing the Saco River Trail, first on our left, then on our right, before slowly arcing northward and skyward to the cliffs of Mt. Webster. Within our first 1.8 miles, we will climb nearly 1750’ before reaching what has been called some of the most stunning views in all of the Whites. Why??? Because at 3000 feet above sea-level, a ridge-line walk located in the shadows of the southern Presidentials, the Montalban Ridge and the Willey Range begins... and with view after view, ledge after ledge, overlooking extraordinary beauty, one would have to be mad to call it anything else... mad I tell you, MAD!!!!

Then, as the WCT rises 900 feet over the next 1.5 miles, we will stride past mountain sides that fall away to the left, and hillsides that reach out to the right, views that open up to the Notch below, and views that open up to the heavens above (that's Mt Washington to you and me). In total, there are four "map" identified overlooks, all before we reach the summit of Webster. A cakewalk on Nature’s icing; a snow packed, rime iced wonderland that most people would swear we stepped thru a looking glass to experience.

From Webster's summit, we’ll step down into the cul between Webster and Jackson, enjoying a bit of peace and serenity, a lull among mountaintop pine, before sticking our heads out above the trees one last time, before descending the Webster-Jackson Trail by way of butt, sled or sole, before reaching our cars, before drinking a brew, before ordering a meal, and before reaching the comfort of our beds and our homes.

Note: This is a hike that will demand a bit of effort upfront (the first 1.8 miles) and a steady nerve along the way (seeing that at 3000 feet the southern side of the mountain gives way as the Notch below). It is also a 7.3 mile, 6+ hour hike that will demand our attention to time, trail conditions, weather and fitness, so be prepared to accept changes to our plans or pace should any of these not be in our favor.

EQUIPMENT CHECKLIST
(gear must be winter weather tested)

Cold Weather/Winter Essentials (required):
• Synthetic or Wool Wicking Underpant & Undershirt
• Mid-layer Synthetic or Wool Insulating Pant & Shirt
• Insulated/Fleece Jacket and/or Vest
• Windproof/Waterproof Shell w/hood & Pant
• Synthetic or Wool Sock Liners (wicking layer)
• Synthetic or Wool Socks (insulating layer)
• Sturdy Hiking Boots (waterproof & insulated)
• Hat & Gloves
• Balaclava
• Goggles
• Extra Insulating Layers (pant & top)
• Extra pair of Socks, Hat & Gloves
• Water (min. 2L) - in a wide-mouthed bottle
• Lunch
• Snack/Energy Food (extra food)
• Map/Compass/Whistle
• Headlamp/Flashlight (w/ fresh lithium batteries)
• Emergency Blanket (so small & light, there's no reason not to carry one)
• MICROspikes or more aggressive hiking crampons
• Snowshoes
• Gaiters

the Remaining Essentials:
• Medication/First Aid Supplies*
• Hand Warmers
• Sleeping Bag & Pad*
• Light-weight Emergency Shelter/Bivy*
• Stove*
• Fire (waterproof matches, lighter, starter)
• Repair Kit/Knife

Optional:
• Sunscreen/Sunglasses/Bug Repellent/Toiletries
• Trekking Poles (very helpful when using snowshoes; very helpful when not using snowshoes)
• Camera/Binoculars

* To Be Carried Among The Group

LET'S NOT UNDERESTIMATE ANYTHING; come prepared for the worst... cold-cold temps., snowy-snowy weather, early darkness and lots of wind.
ALSO... TAKE NOTE: the "Optional" list is significantly smaller than at any other time of year.

Directions

From I-93N, take Exit 35 and drive north along Route 3 for approx. 10 miles. Turn right onto Rt. 302E and continue for approx. 8.5 miles; turn right just past the AMC Highland Center's main lot. Parking is next to the train depot/Shapleigh Bunkhouse.

From North Conway, follow Rt. 16N/302W north toward Glen, NH. At the Rt. 16/302 split, continue straight on Rt. 302W for 20 miles; turn left into the drive just before the AMC Highland Center's main lot. Parking is next to the train depot/Shapleigh Bunkhouse.


Crawford Notch Depot: http://maps.google.com/maps...
Coordinates: 44.217874, -71.411291

Webster Cliff Trailhead: http://maps.google.com/maps?...
Coordinates: 44.170908, -71.388023

Additional Information

Mount Webster: 3910 feet
Mount Jackson: 4052 feet

Distance from trailhead to Jackson: 4.7 miles
Total distance (one-way): 7.3 miles
Total elevation gain: approx. 2800 feet

Exposure: Moderate/Full
Difficulty: Moderate
Pace: Moderate

Sunrise: 6:51 a.m.
Sunset: 5:08 p.m.

Approx. High Temp: Cold
Approx. Low Temp: Really Cold

Weekend AccuWeather Forecast:
http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/bretton-woods-nh/03575/weekend-weather/2173824

7-Day National Weather Forecast (NOAA):
http://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php...

6-Day Mountain-Forecast.com:
http://www.mountain-forecast.com/peaks/Mount-Jackson-New-Hampshire/forecasts/1235

Mt. Washington Observatory Higher Summits Forecast:
http://www.mountwashington.org/weather/summit_forecast.php

Weather & Trail Conditions (AMC):
http://www.outdoors.org/recreation/tripplanner/go/backcountry-weather.cfm

Weather & Trail Conditions (TrailsNH):
http://trailsnh.com/New-Hampshire-4000-Footers.php

Liability Waiver

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.how_to_find_us: Parking is located next to the AMC Highland Center's main lot; the lot closest to the train depot/Shapleigh Bunkhouse. Cell: 860-460-1500
item.name: Webster Jackson via the Webster Cliffs
